intro: Steinchisma stevensianum, commonly known as the African violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
